description: Construction of a two storey end-of-terrace dwellinghouse (with roofspace accommodation) attached to existing dwellinghouse; alterations and extensions to existing dwelling including alteration of existing roof from hip to gable end, raising the ridge height by 225mm, rear roof extension (involving conversion of roofspace to habitable use), installation of one rooflight to front roofslope, single storey rear extension and single storey front porch; with associated car parking, cycle parking, refuse storage and amenity space for the existing and proposed dwelling
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.    Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with Site Location Plan and Drawing Nos. 1404.00, 1404.01 and 1404.02 (received 07/08/2014), Schedule of Areas dated 28/02/2015 and Drawing Nos. 1404.03 Rev B, 1404.04 Rev B and 1404.05 Rev A (received 02/03/2015).  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.      Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document; adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policies 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015); and National Planning Policy Framework (March 2012). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended) no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.    Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7A, 7.4, and 7.B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document; adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policies 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015); and National Planning Policy Framework (March 2012). | No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.  Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7A, 7.4, and 7.B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document; adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policies 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015); and National Planning Policy Framework (March 2012). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A - F of Part 1 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2008 (or any subsequent amendment to that order) no extensions or alterations, porches, or outbuildings shall be carried out at the dwellinghouse hereby approved without the prior permission of the local planning authority.  Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site, to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the area, and in the interests of highway safety in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 & 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 3.5, LV 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 3.5, 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The car parking area, cycle parking and refuse facilities shown on the approved plans shall be completed and available for use at the site prior to the first occupation of the development and thereafter permanently retained.   Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision of car parking, cycle parking and refuse storage in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 2.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 6.13 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 5.16, 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, the residential unit hereby approved shall be constructed to achieve to a minimum Level 4 of the Code for Sustainable Homes (based on November 2010 Technical Guide). The associated reports/ assessment and certifications to demonstrate compliance shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval as follows:  - After commencement of development. Within 3 months of the commencement of construction of the development (Interim Design Stage Assessment and related certification)   - After completion of Development and prior to first occupation.  A Post-Construction Code for Sustainable Homes Review/Report.  - 6 months after the date of first occupation of the development Post-Construction Stage Certificates verified by the BRE, confirming level 4 has been achieved.  Reason:  To ensure a sustainable living environment is secured in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3 of the London Plan 2015; 1.1 (k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policy 5.2 of Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | The dwellinghouse hereby approved shall be constructed to the Lifetime Homes Standards.  Reason: To ensure that the development is accessible by all future occupiers, in accordance with policy 1.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 3.5 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.1 - 7.2 of The London Plan (2015),  and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012)
